title: Matrix File
description: A file containing quantification data in a multi-dimension format.

file_format.comment: Matrix files with file format hic should only specify genomic position dimensions.

content_type.comment: Content Type describes the content of the file.

enum_descriptions.annotated multimodal CRISPR matrix: An object storing single cell CRISPR screen data, integrating multiple modalities such as raw RNA count matrices, sample-level metadata, gene-level metadata, guide-level data, experiment-level metadata, etc.
enum_descriptions.contact matrix: A matrix used in genomic assays, particularly in chromosome conformation capture techniques like Hi-C, to represent the frequency of physical interactions between different regions of the genome.
enum_descriptions.filtered feature barcode matrix: A matrix output from Cell Ranger, where rows represent features and columns represent barcoded spots or cells. It contains counts of sequencing reads after filtering out low-quality or low-abundance features.
enum_descriptions.kallisto single cell RNAseq output: A tar.gz file containing the output of the kb-python count run directory using the nac mode containing everything except for the h5ad file chosen to be the primary result.
enum_descriptions.mitochondrial DNA heteroplasmy: A .rds file generated by the mgatk tool, containing mitochondrial genome sequencing metrics derived from single-cell data.
enum_descriptions.raw feature barcode matrix: A matrix output from Cell Ranger, where rows represent features and columns represent barcoded spots or cells. It contains raw counts of sequencing reads before any filtering or normalization.
enum_descriptions.sample barcode count matrix: A matrix of cells (rows) by MULTI-seq sample barcode (columns) count.
enum_descriptions.sparse gene count matrix: A matrix where rows represent genes and columns represent samples or cells, containing counts of sequencing reads that map to each gene.
enum_descriptions.sparse peak count matrix: A matrix used in assays like ATAC-seq or ChIP-seq, where rows represent genomic regions (peaks) and columns represent samples or cells.
enum_descriptions.sparse transcript count matrix: A matrix where rows represent transcripts and columns represent samples or cells, containing counts of sequencing reads that map to each transcript.
enum_descriptions.transcriptome annotations: Detailed information about the transcripts detected in a genomic assay, including their genomic coordinates, gene names, and other relevant annotations.

principal_dimension.title: Principal Dimension
principal_dimension.description: The principal dimension of the matrix.

secondary_dimensions.title: Secondary Dimensions
secondary_dimensions.description: The secondary, tertiary....n levels of dimensions of the matrix.

dbxrefs.comment: This file type currently does not support any external resource submission.
